top_categories.workout_context: Rad am Ring Gravel’s german eifel, european gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Rad am Ring Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Rad am Ring Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Rad am Ring Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rad am Ring Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Rad am Ring Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Rad am Ring Gravel’s german eifel gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Rad am Ring Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Rad am Ring Gravel’s german eifel gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Rad am Ring Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on german eifel gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Rad am Ring Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Rad am Ring Gravel count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rad am Ring Gravel’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rad am Ring Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on german eifel gravel to build confidence. Expect: german eifel, european gravel, germany.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 62 miles of german eifel gravel in Nürburg, Germany.
